definition: surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Part two: The form of concurrence of civil liabilities.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是民事責任競合的形態。

sentences.english: If the act is not so recognized, the performer shall bear civil liability for it.
sentences.chinese: 未經追認的行爲，由行爲人承擔民事責任。

sentences.english: We should search thoroughly for any civil liabilities of the client.
sentences.chinese: 對於當事人的民事責任，我們必須窮追到底。

sentences.english: Indian opposition parties oppose legislation granting civil liability protection to U.S. energy companies.
sentences.chinese: 印度反對派反對給予美國公司民事責任保護的立法。

sentences.english: Chapter three is tort liabilities of mental health.
sentences.chinese: 第三章具體闡述了心理健康侵權民事責任。

sentences.english: Where the transferor fails to give notice, he shall take the corresponding responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 轉讓人不履行告知義務的，應當承擔相應的民事責任。

sentences.english: Part one: A general theory of the concurrence of civil liabilities.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分是民事責任競合的一般原理。

sentences.english: Part two. The problem of civil liability star of false endorsement.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，分析明星虛假代言行爲民事責任問題。

sentences.english: The capacity for civil liability has nothing to do with the capacity for civil conduct.
sentences.chinese: 一切自然人都具有民事權利能力和民事責任能力。

sentences.english: Therefore, the practice of civil liability ascertainment is of greater applicability.
sentences.chinese: 因此，民事責任追究機制具有更廣泛的適用性。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter mainly discourses upon civil liability borne by CA to relying party.
sentences.chinese: 第四章論述了電子認證機構隊信賴人承擔的民事責任。

sentences.english: Part II studies the nature of the civil liability of lawyering.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分分析了律師民事責任的法律性質。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
